title: Urgent: Expert Needed for macOS Sequoia File Descriptor Limit Issue Causing Database Failures
desc: Problem Description: I'm experiencing critical file descriptor limit issues on macOS Sequoia (15.5) that only appeared after the recent update. My time-series database (QuestDB) and Python scripts that have worked flawlessly for months now regularly crash with "Too many open files" (Error 24) and "Too many open files in system" (Error 23) errors, despite extensive troubleshooting. System Information: -MacBook Pro M4 Pro, 24GB RAM -macOS Sequoia (15.x) - latest version -QuestDB (time-series database) -Python applications with database connectivity Symptoms: -Test script can only open ~254,000 files despite setting limits to 500,000 -Database operations fail with code 23/24 errors -Occasional system kernel panics related to resource exhaustion -Issues persist when running database in Docker and natively Troubleshooting Already Performed: -Increased system-wide limits via sysctl (kern.maxfiles=1000000, kern.maxfilesperproc=500000) -Raised user limits with ulimit -n 500000 -Created LaunchDaemons to persist limit changes -Completely reinstalled macOS (clean install) -Tried running in Docker and natively -Created diagnostic tests isolating the issue -Configured QuestDB with reduced resource usage -Verified issue is specific to Sequoia update (worked fine before) Urgency: This is actively disrupting my production systems and development work. Looking for immediate assistance and willing to compensate accordingly for quick resolution.

title: We are building a web-based construction estimating tool that allows
desc: We are building a web-based construction estimating tool that allows users to search for materials, select items, and generate a detailed quote sheet. We are looking for an experienced FastAPI developer to implement the backend portion of the quoting workflow and connect it to a SQL database. . Scope of Work: You will be responsible for: Building FastAPI endpoints to: Search for items by name/UPC (data stored in SQL) Add selected items to a quote Edit or remove items from a quote Generate a final quote sheet (JSON or PDF) Creating and managing SQL database models for: Items (UPC, name, description, price, etc.) Quotes (user ID, timestamp, status) Quote items (line items, quantity, total) Integrating with existing item data (CSV or database) Ensuring API is scalable, well-structured, and secure (Optional) If familiar: working with Elasticsearch for fast item searching Technical Requirements: Strong experience with FastAPI Proficient in SQL and Most likely SQL (like PostgreSQL or SQLite) for storing: Experience designing and consuming REST APIs Comfortable working with structured item data (UPC, price lists) Familiarity with PDF generation, Pandas, or Elasticsearch is a plus Able to write clean, modular, and well-documented code Bonus Skills: Experience with frontend frameworks (e.g., React or Vue) Deliverables: FastAPI backend for full quote workflow SQL schema and migrations Sample endpoint tests or Postman collection Basic admin/debugging route for reviewing quotes

title: News Article Extraction and Summarization
desc: Build a script that pulls 20 to 30 articles daily from each of several major news publications, (Bloomberg, WSJ, FT, NYT), where I have active subscriptions. Only articles in specific sections are needed (e.g., Markets, Economics; so, for example, do not include Opinion, Sports, or general news). I already have much of the infrastructure set up, including the database, ChatGPT processing, tagging of articles, and getting the RSS feeds from the publications. You can utilise these. The missing piece is to create a function that can accept links to the articles themselves and then return whatever was inside the article. My attempts are identified as a bot and I am kicked out! Once the articles are pulled out, restate/summarize each article using OpenAI's GPT-4, via my existing ChatGPT Plus subscription/API key. Summaries must go beyond headlines and capture most of the article's information in structured, readable form. Each summary should include title, date, source, and the article URL. Note: No proxy, headless, or stealth scraping tools. All scraping must be conducted using a full browser in visible mode, with realistic pacing and standard browser headers. Requests should follow natural navigation paths and avoid rapid-fire access in order to mimic normal user behavior to avoid bot detection. The process can be set up to run on Chrome on my computer, where I typically look at these sites. Deliverables Working script (or set of scripts) to run the process daily.

title: Build Slack Bot Using Azure OpenAI GPT (Recreate Custom GPT with File Handling)
desc: I‚Äôve built a custom GPT using OpenAI‚Äôs ‚ÄúMy GPTs‚Äù feature, including 5 PDF documents and detailed instructions. I want to rebuild this GPT in code, host it on Azure, and make it accessible to users via a Slack channel. We have no Azure account, no experience with server-side deployment, and need step-by-step guidance on everything, from setting up an Azure account to deploying the GPT and connecting it to Slack. I‚Äôm looking for a freelancer to take full ownership of this end-to-end project, delivering a clean implementation, beginner-friendly documentation, and clear explanations in non-technical terms. Scope of Work Azure Setup & Backend * Guide me to create an Azure account, set up billing, and configure: * Azure OpenAI Service (GPT-4-turbo) * Azure App Service or Azure Functions (for backend hosting) * Azure Blob Storage (for storing 5 PDF documents) * Provide clear instructions or live guidance for setup, as I have no Azure experience. * Estimate monthly Azure costs (e.g., for OpenAI, hosting, PDF storage) and recommend cost optimization (e.g., auto-scaling, usage monitoring). Recreate My GPT in Code * Replicate the behavior of my ‚ÄúMy GPT‚Äù assistant using the Azure OpenAI API: * System message (will be provided) * Tool use or function calling logic (if needed) * Integrate 5 PDF documents: * Recommend the best way to include these files (e.g., embedding, retrieval) and explain your approach in simple terms. * Ensure GPT uses PDF content for accurate answers (e.g., via text extraction or retrieval mechanism). Slack Integration * Create and configure a Slack App with: * A bot user that replies in specific channels or to DMs. * OAuth and proper permission scopes. * Connect the Slack App to the Azure backend to: * Receive messages, forward to GPT, and send replies back to Slack. * Optional: Basic context across a thread or user, only if simple and cost-effective (explain if you recommend this). Final Deliverables * Live Slack bot connected to Azure-hosted GPT * Deployment pipeline (e.g., GitHub ‚Üí Azure or manual). * Documentation written for a non-technical audience, with step-by-step instructions for: * Managing the system (e.g., updating PDFs, using the Slack bot and updating the GPT). * Basic troubleshooting (e.g., restarting the bot, checking logs). * A test plan to verify GPT accuracy (e.g., comparing responses to the original ‚ÄúMy GPT‚Äù) and Slack bot functionality. About You You should have experience with: * Azure OpenAI Service (or OpenAI API with transition to Azure). * Azure App Service or Azure Functions. * Slack App development (Bolt.js or Python Slack SDK preferred). * Prompt engineering and GPT tuning. * File-based knowledge integration (e.g., PDF processing, embedding, or retrieval). * Guiding non-technical clients through technical setups, with excellent communication skills to explain concepts in plain language. Bonus if you‚Äôve worked on: * Setting up Azure accounts from scratch or managing Azure costs for small projects. * Multi-user Slack bots or context-aware bots. * Logging/token usage monitoring or function-calling in GPT workflows. What I‚Äôll Provide * My GPT‚Äôs system prompt. * 5 PDF documents. * Slack workspace and test channel. * Collaboration to create an Azure account with your guidance. * Quick feedback during the project. Timeline & Budget * I‚Äôd like to start ASAP and aim for a working Slack integration within 2‚Äì3 weeks if possible. * Please propose a realistic timeline with milestones (e.g., Azure setup, GPT coding, Slack integration). * I‚Äôm open to hourly or fixed-price bids. Please provide: * A rough estimate of your fees (hourly rate/total hours or fixed price). * Expected Azure costs (e.g., monthly costs for OpenAI, hosting, PDF storage). * Advice on keeping Azure costs low, as I have no experience with Azure pricing. * Optional: Availability for post-deployment support (e.g., 1‚Äì2 weeks of bug fixes or Q&A) is a plus. When Applying, Please Include * Examples of Slack bots, GPT deployments, or Azure projects you‚Äôve done. * Experience with Azure OpenAI, Slack apps, and PDF integration with GPTs. * A brief plan for helping me set up an Azure account and managing costs. * Your approach to integrating the 5 PDFs with the GPT, explained in simple terms. * Preferred backend stack (e.g., Node.js, Python). * Proposed timeline with milestones. * Rough cost estimate (your fees + Azure costs). * Questions or suggestions for this project.

title: Robocorp bot developer for developing a simple bot
desc: I‚Äôm looking for a skilled and experienced automation developer who is comfortable working with Robocorp and Python Playwright. This is a very straightforward task, and someone familiar with the tools should be able to finish it quite quickly. If you‚Äôve already worked with Robocorp and Playwright before, this will be quick task. The job requires basic knowledge of automation concepts and how to interact with web elements using Playwright, along with an understanding of how to set up and run robots in the Robocorp environment. You should know how to structure a Robocorp project properly, organize tasks and environments using the robot.yaml file, and handle basic data flow through variables or environment configs. Familiarity with RCC and running tasks locally is also expected. You must be comfortable dealing with browser sessions, navigation, and DOM elements using Playwright, and ideally you should know how to troubleshoot common browser automation challenges like timeouts, selectors, and dynamic content. The task involves setting up a small script with logic that is typical in web automation. Nothing too complex or advanced, but attention to detail is important. You are expected to test the script thoroughly before submitting, and make sure everything runs without issues. If you're someone who has worked with Robocorp Work Items, Control Room, or browser-based RPA bots, that's a plus, though not mandatory for this specific task. Understanding how to handle page loading, selectors, and wait mechanisms in Playwright is crucial. Experience in managing robot environments with conda.yaml, handling credentials using environment variables, and setting up Google Sheets or similar integrations is also appreciated. The selected freelancer should be able to follow clear instructions, maintain clean code, and provide timely updates. You must have the ability to write maintainable and reusable scripts, with logging and basic error handling in place. Documentation is not mandatory for this task, but writing self-explanatory code will be considered a big plus. This is a one-time task but may lead to more work in the future. If you deliver quality work, I‚Äôll be happy to bring you on board for similar projects. I frequently need small to mid-sized bots and automation flows built out, so there is definitely a scope for repeat work. Please make sure you're familiar with: Robocorp project structure Playwright with Python Handling browser sessions and automation with Playwright Using RCC and Robocorp Code extension in VS Code Basic environment management with conda.yaml Writing readable and clean Python code Reading and clicking web elements reliably Running robots from local machine The task will be shared after the contract is initiated, and you will have full support if you run into setup issues. Again, this task is very simple and will not take much time for someone experienced. Newbies might struggle, but experienced devs should be done within an hour or so.

title: Full-Stack Python + AI Dev for Video Startup ‚Äî $250, 1 Month PT
desc: We‚Äôre a small startup building an AI‚Äëdriven platform that turns written ideas into engaging videos. Our proof of concept is already running, and we‚Äôre looking for an extra developer to help us accelerate toward launch. Relaxed startup vibe‚ÄØ‚Äî‚ÄØthe rate‚Äôs modest for now, but we‚Äôre in this for the long haul and want teammates who‚Äôll grow with the product. What you‚Äôll actually do * Docker‚Äëify & deploy** a handful of pre‚Äëbuilt ComfyUI graphs (image‚Üívideo, lip‚Äësync, character tools). *No hunting required ‚Äî we‚Äôll give you every workflow, checkpoint, and node we‚Äôve already licensed.* * Wrap them in a **lightweight FastAPI (or gRPC) layer** so our Next.js front‚Äëend can call them. * Goal is to run them on a Serverless Runpod endpoint * Keep the images lean, GPU‚Äëready, and documented so anyone can spin them up on RunPod. * Jump in on **prompt tweaks / AI best‚Äëpractices** when we hit weird results. --- You‚Äôll fit right in if‚Ä¶ * Python & Bash are second nature, and you‚Äôve built at least one Docker image that hugs a GPU. * ComfyUI doesn‚Äôt scare you (export/import JSON, fix missing nodes, swap checkpoints). * You‚Äôve played with diffusion / LLM APIs enough to know CFG ‚â†‚ÄØC‚Äë3PO. * You lean on AI copilots to move faster, not replace thinking. * A friendly async stand‚Äëup (‚ÄúYesterday / Today / Blockers / Hours‚Äù) sounds reasonable. --- #### Nice‚Äëto‚Äëhave superpowers * Basic React/Next.js to poke your own endpoints. * Prior lip‚Äësync or character‚Äëconsistency tinkering. * Experience on RunPod, Replicate, Lambda Labs, etc. --- #### What we bring to the table * **All paid workflows & assets** ‚Äî just plug, tweak, and ship. * Clear product roadmap through June (soft launch mid‚Äëmonth). Relaxed startup vibe‚ÄØ‚Äî‚ÄØthe rate‚Äôs modest for now, but we‚Äôre in this for the long haul and want teammates who‚Äôll grow with the product. * **\$5‚Äì10‚ÄØUSD/hr**, 15‚Äë20‚ÄØhrs/week, quick payments, --- #### Sound fun? Shoot over: 1. A link or screenshot of *any* AI/ComfyUI or GPU Docker thing you‚Äôve built. 2. Two lines on why you‚Äôre pumped about generative video. 3. The phrase **‚ÄúSTARTUP‚ÄëREADY‚Äù** at the top so we know you read this. We‚Äôll reply within 24‚ÄØhrs with a mini test and an NDA. Let‚Äôs build something cool together! üé¨

title: Lead Python & Spark Developer with Kubernetes Expertise
desc: Summary We are seeking a highly experienced Software Engineer to lead a team of five developers in building and maintaining batch data processing solutions. Our on-premise environment runs on OpenShift (Kubernetes), and we are looking for someone who can introduce cutting-edge technologies while ensuring robust deployment, testing, and software engineering best practices. **Project Scope** - **Duration**: 3 months, with the possibility of extension - **Data Processing**: Primarily batch (moderate scale) - **Environment**: On-premise Kubernetes (OpenShift) **Key Responsibilities** - Provide technical leadership and mentor a team of 5 developers - Design and implement efficient batch data processing pipelines using Python and Apache Spark - Oversee deployment and testing strategies in an on-premise OpenShift environment - Lead the adoption of new technologies and best practices to enhance system performance, reliability, and maintainability - Collaborate with stakeholders to ensure requirements are met, and milestones are delivered on time - Manage code quality, documentation, and software engineering standards across the team **Required Skills & Experience** - **Expertise in Python**: Proven track record of building robust, enterprise-grade Python applications - **Apache Spark**: Hands-on experience with designing and optimizing batch data workloads - **Kubernetes (OpenShift)**: Solid understanding of container orchestration, deployment, and cluster management in on-premise environments - **Leadership Experience**: Previous experience leading teams, setting technical direction, and managing project deliverables - **Software Engineering Best Practices**: Familiarity with version control (Git), CI/CD pipelines, automated testing, and code reviews - **Remote Collaboration**: Must be able to work remotely but be available during German business hours **Nice-to-Have** - Exposure to other big data tools or frameworks (e.g., Hive, HDFS, etc.) - Experience with on-premise security and networking configurations - Familiarity with agile methodologies and project management tools **Engagement & Communication** - This is a remote position, but the candidate must be able to overlap significantly with Central European (German) time zone. - Strong communication skills (both written and verbal) are essential, as you will be leading a distributed team and coordinating with stakeholders. **Why Join Us?** - Opportunity to work on cutting-edge data solutions and lead a high-performing team - Potential for project extensions based on performance and project needs - Collaborative environment that values technical excellence and innovation If you have a proven track record in leading data engineering teams, building batch data processing solutions in Python and Spark, and deploying applications on Kubernetes (OpenShift), we‚Äôd love to hear from you!

title: Small RPA / Scrapping Bots Needed to scrap a 3 sites

I need to scrap 3 different sites; and in each of them I need to click on many rows and copy elements from each row and paste them into a GoogleSheet. I would like to automate the task so that I manually trigger a RPA when I'm in each of these sites and get it to export the data into a sheet. I would like to use a free RPA for this since this is such a small task . It would be better if the RPA tool works in the cloud as I work from a Mac and some desktop RPAs are limited to Microsoft users. Given the fact that it's sensitive data involved I will have to give you remote access to my machine; but it should be a very short and straight forward task for someone with the right skills and experience.

title: Computer Vision Specialist ‚Äì Build Lightweight Virtual Try-On Engine
desc: We are developing a next-gen fashion-tech platform and are looking for a skilled Computer Vision developer to build a lightweight, pose-aware Virtual Try-On (VTR) engine. Our current system uses third-party APIs for outfit try-ons, but we now wish to replace these with a fully proprietary pipeline that offers better control, performance, and output optimization while minimizing backend load. This is a high-priority assignment, with an immediate start and a fixed sprint timeline. The selected partner will work closely with other developers (backend, mobile, chatbot, and UI) to ensure clean integration and seamless handoff. Project Scope (Finer details to be shared with our shortlisted candidates): ‚Ä¢ Build a modular engine that wraps outfit elements onto mannequin models & real user photos ‚Ä¢ Maintain body alignment, silhouette accuracy, and visual consistency ‚Ä¢ Ensure compression, format hygiene, and structured output delivery ‚Ä¢ Work independently (asynchronous) with minimal supervision while aligning to naming, storage, & review protocols Key Requirements: ‚Ä¢ Strong grasp of OpenCV, MediaPipe, pose estimation, and image overlay techniques ‚Ä¢ Experience with garment compositing and photorealistic output generation ‚Ä¢ Ability to structure dev-ready outputs (naming logic, compression, optimization) ‚Ä¢ Must be available immediately and able to prioritize this over other engagements ‚Ä¢ Willingness to sign an NDA + service contract before formal assignment ‚Ä¢ Should provide 30-day support post-launch for handover, bug fixes, and minor enhancements ‚Ä¢ Should be comfortable collaborating with a distributed dev team across mobile, backend, and frontend layers Budget & Structure: ‚Ä¢ Fixed Fee: ‚Çπ50,000 (Milestone-based) ‚Ä¢ Bonus: ‚Çπ10,000 (for on-time, high-quality, dev-ready output) ‚Ä¢ Timeline: 3-week sprint ‚Ä¢ Milestones and deliverables will be detailed in the final contract (SoW + TCD) Test Case (Required Before Final Selection): Shortlisted candidates will be asked to complete a paid test sprint (‚Çπ3,000) involving: ‚Ä¢ Wrapping a sample outfit onto mannequin model images ‚Ä¢ Wrapping the same outfit onto a user-submitted full-body photo ‚Ä¢ Outputs must follow compression rules and filename conventions ‚Ä¢ No use of third-party APIs This helps us assess technique, output quality, and collaboration fit before moving into the main engagement. To Apply: ‚Ä¢ Share past CV projects or image overlay samples (even basic pose-based work) ‚Ä¢ Confirm tools and libraries you use (OpenCV, MediaPipe, etc.) ‚Ä¢ Confirm your availability and ability to meet the 3-week sprint window ‚Ä¢ Confirm readiness to sign NDA and provide 30-day post-launch support

title: Create a Custom TradingView Indicator to Show All Candlestick Patterns on Every Timeframe*
desc: I am looking for an experienced Pine Script developer to create a custom TradingView indicator that detects and displays all major candlestick patterns directly on the chart. The indicator should work across all timeframes and be able to identify both bullish and bearish patterns. **Key Requirements:** * Detect and label major candlestick patterns such as: * Engulfing (bullish & bearish) * Doji * Hammer & Inverted Hammer * Shooting Star * Morning Star & Evening Star * Piercing Line * Dark Cloud Cover * Harami (bullish & bearish) * And others as applicable * Show pattern names directly on the chart (on/above/below candles) * Should work on all timeframes (1min to daily and higher) * Option to enable/disable specific patterns from settings * Lightweight and optimized for performance * Clean and easy-to-read plotting **Optional (bonus):** * Option to customize colors or labels * Add alert conditions for selected patterns **Deliverables:** * Fully commented Pine Script code * Installation instructions * Support for any bugs or small fixes after delivery

title: Data Scientist/Engineer Needed for Predictive Modeling of Structured Scientific Logs (Python)
desc: We are looking for a Python-savvy data scientist or engineer with a strong grasp of structured scientific or technical log data and predictive modeling. This short-term engagement will focus on building a modular proof of concept that reads structured logs, cleans and prepares the data, and applies a predictive model to infer values across a predefined data grid. The data is sequential and indexed by depth, and may include spatial attributes for certain use cases. This is a research-style role ideal for someone with experience working with physical science data (e.g., environmental, geological, or engineering logs). ‚úÖ Responsibilities: Read and parse structured text-based technical log files (e.g., .las, .csv). Normalize and clean time-series or depth-series multivariable data. Train regression models to predict missing or extrapolated values. Produce visualizations of model performance and predictions. Document the pipeline clearly and deliver reproducible code (preferably in notebooks or modular scripts). üîß Required Skills: Strong Python skills with pandas, numpy, scikit-learn Familiarity with scientific data preprocessing, smoothing, and interpolation Experience applying regression algorithms like Random Forest or XGBoost Ability to plot and interpret multivariate time-series/depth-indexed data Clear and efficient code documentation practices üéØ Bonus Skills: Exposure to ASCII-based technical data formats (e.g., LAS, DLIS, etc.) Understanding of spatial or gridded datasets Experience with geoscience, environmental modeling, or similar domains Tools like lasio, geopandas, scipy.interpolate, PyVista, Plotly üìÅ Deliverables: Python pipeline to load and clean log files Trained model that predicts selected variable(s) across unseen samples Grid-based prediction visualizations (basic maps or cross-sections) All source code and documentation for repeatability
